results.title: A Day in June: disengagement in the Golan
results.creator_credit: Joe O'Brien, Edward Magruder Jones, Gilbert Lauzun and United Nations Films
results.brief_description: In June 1974, a new United Nations peace-keeping force took up positions in the war torn Golan Heights. The force was called UNDOF - United Nations Disengagement Observer Force and its mandate, to observe that the ceasefire agreements, signed in Geneva by Israel and Syria, were adhered to.
results.title_for_label: A Day in June: disengagement in the Golan
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joe O’Brien, Edward Magruder Jones, Gilbert Lauzun and United Nations Films

results.title: A Day for Being Irish
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
Every year since 1606 the town of Ballycastle in County Antrim, Northern Ireland has held the Lammas Fair to which people come to trade, barter and generally have a good time. Originally the fair was set up for the Scottish overlords of the time to trade their horses for black cattle and other goods that they needed. The nearby islanders of Rathlin also participate in the fair by selling seaweed.

results.title: A Day at the Races
results.brief_description: A veterinarian posing as a doctor and a race-horse owner and his friends struggle to help keep a sanitarium open with the help of a misfit race-horse in this Marx Brothers classic.

constellations_other.name: When music speaks
constellations_other.description: Some characters or moments are expressed more intensely through a musical motif than dialogue or action.

results.description: Doctor Hugo Hackenbush, Tony, and Stuffy try and save Judy’s farm by winning a big race with her horse. There are a few problems. Hackenbush runs a high priced clinic for the wealthy who don’t know he has his degree in Veterinary Medicine.
description_for_label: Doctor Hugo Hackenbush, Tony, and Stuffy try and save Judy’s farm by winning a big race with her horse. There are a few problems. Hackenbush runs a high priced clinic for the wealthy who don’t know he has his degree in Veterinary Medicine.

results.title: A Day at the races
results.creator_credit: Sam Wood, Lawrence Weingarten and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A Marx Brothers movie combining humor and music. The plot, which shifts from a sanitorium to a race track, introduces a horse doctor masquerading as sanitorium director, a jockey who encourages his horse to win by showing it a picture of the man it hates, a vendor of bad racing tips and a vampire dressed in revealing clothing. Also stars Maureen O’Sullivan.

results.title: A Day at the dump
results.brief_description: A case history examining the folly of haphazard waste disposal. For 25 years, a quarter of a million tons of municipal refuse a year went up in smoke at a Washington dump. Depicts the conditions before funds for a comprehensive waste disposal program were made available. (The solution is presented in “Burn, bury or what?”)

results.title: A Day at the Ascot Vale School No 2608
results.brief_description: Portrays the outdoor life at a school in the 1920s. Shows school dress, assembly, physical training, organised dancing and games. Junior Red Cross activities, Mothers Club and School Committee.

results.title: A Dangerous life
results.creator_credit: R. Markowitz, Hal McElroy and McElroy & McElroy
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the four day revolution in the Philippines. Told through the eyes of a television reporter and photojournalist, it backgrounds the struggle that led to the 1986 revolution which saw Aquino become president succeeding the ousted Ferdinand Marcos.
